orig_translation: Vtedy to nebolo nejaké mesto v tých prvých rokoch občianskej vojny, ale pastorovi sa páčilo. Od prvej minúta čo vystúpil z vlaku,/i sa začal rozhliadať okolo.

orig_text: In the great Gold Rush, Alaska was the hope and dream of men, the ruthless siren of the Far North, beckoning thousands to her icy bosom.
orig_translation: Ëndrra e mijëra njerëzve të cilët i ka kapluar Sirena jo zemërmirë e Veriut të Madh në mbretërinë e saj, e akullt dhe e pa kërkuar.

orig_text: Many lost their lives. Some fell by the wayside, others lost courage and turned back. But the brave went on.
orig_translation: Duke e kaluar rrethin Chilkoot, në drejtim të fushave me ar në mes të një shkretëtire të paimagjinueshme, një numër i madh i njerëzve të rraskapitur aty e kanë lënë jetën.

orig_text: After scouring the country for food, the Little Fellow had to admit he had seen nothing, not even a field mouse.
orig_translation: Duke kaluar tërë rrethin ju ka dashur të kupton se nuk ka gjetur asgjë... edhe një minjë polar nuk e ka gjetur.

orig_text: Out of the night came the Little Fellow, towards the dancehall, that beacon light of pleasure, that retreat of lost dreams.
orig_translation: Një natë i Vogli mbërrinë në Saloon drita e argëtimit, vend i ëndrrave të harruara.

orig_text: Hank Curtis' cabin was a stone's throw from the dancehall. Hank was a mining engineer who lived alone and occasionally went on long expeditions into the Far North.
orig_translation: Kasolla e Hankut ka qenë afër saloonit.

orig_text: Hank was kind and human, and our hero cold and hungry, and the beans smelled good and the coffee was steaming hot.
orig_translation: Si inxhenjer i minierës ka jetuar i vetëm ndonjëherë ka ardhur në Veriun e Madh. Ka qenë i mirë dhe human...

orig_text: Since that night in the dancehall the Little Fellow hadn't seen Georgia, but an incident was to bring them together again.
orig_translation: Prej asaj kohe i Vogli nuk e ka parë më Georginë por një takim i paplanifikuar prap i bashkon ata.

orig_text: There she stood, her loveliness lighting the room, filling his soul with the music of romance for which he was so ill-fitted. As she introduced her friends, his heart began to sing.
orig_translation: Bukuria e saj e ka përfshirë të gjithë vendin dhe e ka mbushur shpirtin e tij me muzikë.

orig_text: And in that cabin his secret was revealed, his love for Georgia. And the girls giggled and laughed, perhaps in order to hide their pity.
orig_translation: Fshehtësia e tij ka qenë e hapur e ka dashur Georginë.

orig_text: For in the world of the dancehall it wasn't wise for the girls to reveal their hearts.
orig_translation: Vajzat kanë qeshur që ta ruajnë urrejtjen e tyre.

orig_text: And so they thought they'd have a little fun with him.
orig_translation: Në atë botë të vallëzimit... çdo ndjenjë është e ndaluar. Ato i kanë qeshur atij...

orig_text: There in the gloaming they sat, their faces alight with mischief, but all the while his heart was singing. And so she fooled and flirted and stroked his hair. He knew she was fooling, but he was happy.
orig_translation: Tjetri në gjysëm errësirë... me fytyrë shumë me urretje por zemra e tij ka kënduar derisa ajo ja ka përkdhelur flokët.

orig_text: The light of her loveliness would be gone. And he would be left with an emptiness, to return to his bleak, lonely existence. "Pardon me", said the Little Fellow,
orig_translation: Por ajo do të shkon... ai do të jetë prap i vetmuar në atë ekzistencë të tij aq të zymtë.

orig_text: In the midst of all their revelry the vague memory of a promise crept into Georgia's mind. "Let's go up and visit the Little Fellow", she said.
orig_translation: Derisa janë argëtuar, Georgias i kujtohet premtimi i saj, thotë: "Hajde të shkojmë tek njeriu i Vogël!"

orig_text: Then fate - it's always fate - played its little joke, and again the elements laughed, roared and thundered, but through it all our heroes soundly slumbered.
orig_translation: Por fati me ta prap ka qeshur. Edhe këtë herë natyra ja ka filluar të gërmojë, të vetëtojë por nuk i ka zgjuar heronjët tanë.

orig_text: The Little Fellow awoke, blissfully ignorant of what happened the night before, but feeling definitely conscious of "the morning after".
orig_translation: Është zgjuar duke mos ditur se çfarë ka ndodhur natën, por me kujtimin... që mbrëmë ka festuar diçka.

orig_text: Now they were homeward bound and they were leaving the hardship and toil of Alaska to live in the land of milk and honey. To live, laugh and indulge themselves in the lap of luxury.
orig_translation: Duke u kthyer e kanë lënë të pa menduarën Alaskë për jetesë në tokën e mjaltit dhe qumshtit në krahë të njerëvzve.

orig_text: Then you attach the poster like this... to flatten the poster and to smooth out the lumps.
orig_translation: pastaj i jep një dorë tjetër të lehtë me ngjitës... që ta sheshosh afishen dhe që të mos ngelen flluska.

orig_text: Because if you leave any lumps... the inspector will see them and he'll fine you.
orig_translation: Sepse po le flluska... do i shohë inspektori dhe do të gjobisë. More vesh?

orig_text: All right, but if we're having a meeting, it'd better be more than poking' holes in the air with your finger.
orig_translation: Në rregull, por nëse ka mbledhje, kjo mos të jet vetëm lëvizje e gishtit kah ajri.

orig_text: Now you run on home to your mother, and tell her tell her everything's all right and there aren't any more guns in the valley.
orig_translation: Tash vrap në shtëpi ke nëna dhe thuaji se çdo gjë është në rregull dhe në luginë më nuk ka pistoleta .

orig_text: The grave's dug, and the defunct is as ready as the embalmer can make him... but there'll be no funeral.
orig_translation: - Varri është hapur... edhe kufoma është e gatshme, por varrim nuk do të ketë.

orig_text: Yes, when I think of... of what he might do. No, when I remember the feeling in my chest this morning... as I saw him run away. From us.
orig_translation: Po, kur kujtohem ç'na ka bërë deri dje... dhe si ndjehesha sot... kur e shihja se si ikte.

orig_text: Have a look around and see if there's something that strikes your eyes, and I'll have my mechanic give yours the once-over.
orig_translation: Hidh nje sy dhe shiko mos te pelqen ndonje dhe do ve mekanikun ti hedhi nje sy tendes.

orig_text: - You want some coffee? - No, thank you. I'm in a hurry... and just wanna make a change.
orig_translation: - Jo, faleminderit, po shpejtoj... dhe vetem te bej ndrimin.

orig_text: One thing people never oughta be when they're buyin' used cars... and that's in a hurry, but like I said, it's too nice a day to argue.
orig_translation: Njerezit nuk duhet te shpejtojne kur blejne makina te perdorura... sidomos sot qe eshte dhe dite e bukur.

orig_text: Well, the, uh, mattress is soft and... there's hangers in the closet and stationery... with "Bates Motel" printed on it... in case you wanna make your friends back home feel envious.
orig_translation: Po stroma eshte e bute... dhe ne dullape ka varese rrobash... me shenjen "Moteli Beits"... per tja u treguar shokeve dhe ti beni te kene zili.

orig_text: They tell you what its ingredients are... and how it's guaranteed to exterminate every insect in the world, but they do not tell you whether it's painless.
orig_translation: Te thone permbajtjen qe kane... dhe sigurine qe zhdukin c'do insekt, Po nuk thone ne vdesin pa dhimbje.

orig_text: Last two days I've been to so many motels my eyes are bleary with neon, but this is the first place that looks like it's hiding from the world.
orig_translation: Kam shkuar ne kaq shume motele saqe me dhembin syte nga neonet, Po ky eshte i pari qe duket si i fshehur.

orig_text: I think he got himself a hot lead as to where your sister was goin', probably from Norman Bates, and called you to keep you still while he took off after her and the money.
orig_translation: Ai ka gjetur ku eshte motra juaj, dhe po e ndjek per leket e ka mesuar nga Normani, dhe te telefoni qe rinit ketu dhe ai te ndiqte leket.

orig_text: Mrs. Bates poisoned this guy she was... involved with... when she found out he was married, then took a helpin' of the same stuff herself.
orig_translation: Znj. Bejts helmoi ate burrin... qe kishte... kur mesoi se ai ishte i martuar,

orig_text: To understand it the way I understood it, hearing it from the "mother"... that is from the "mother" half of Norman's mind... you have to go back ten years... to the time when Norman murdered his mother and her lover.
orig_translation: Qe ta kuptoni si une, duke i degjuar nga "mamaja"... domethene nga ana e mendjes qe ishte "mamaja"... Duhet te ktheheni dhejt vjet mbrapa... Te koha kur Normani vrau mamane dhe te dashurin e saj.
